The secondary flight feathers are shorter than the primaries and have pointed tips. These feathers are used mainly for forward motion during takeoff and landing. This species has a very large tail which serves as a rudder when flying. When the bird lands, the tail is held out horizontally behind the body. American robins feed mostly on insects such as caterpillars, moths, beetles, grasshoppers
